comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Commonwealth War Graves Commission Lists the following NEAL, W Rank:Lance Corporal Service No:T/835 Date of Death:21/05/1915 Regiment/Service:Army Service Corps West Riding Div. Grave Reference III. F. 8. Cemetery MERVILLE COMMUNAL CEMETERY they can be found here www.cwgc.org/search-for-war-dead/casualty/539260/NEAL,%20W A photography of his grave can be found here twgpp.org/information.php?id=2352848

comment.author: 77235581@N00
comment._content: His first name was Walter (from British Army WWI Medal Rolls Index Cards, 1914-1920). The index card states he died 23 May 1915.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
He was born, resided in and enlisted in Leeds. His listing shows he died of wounds.
There are 2 candidates: one born in 1892 in Leeds, son of Walter & Mary Ann, the other in 1894 in Middleton (registration district Hunslet), the son of Earnest & Sarah Ann.
